articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: In a historic move, the UK gives up sovereignty of a strategic group of islands in the Indian Ocean.
articles.title: UK hands sovereignty of Chagos Islands to Mauritius

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The presenter's scheduled interview with Johnson was pulled after she accidentally sent him her notes.
articles.title: Laura Kuenssberg 'embarrassed' by Boris Johnson email error

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Governor Andrew Bailey hints that borrowing costs could come down faster if inflation stays in line.
articles.title: Interest rates: Bank of England could be 'more aggressive' on cuts

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A man charged with sexual assault has been advertising as a private tutor for children, the BBC finds.
articles.title: Sex charge tutor case reveals ‘massive safeguarding hole’

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Lawyers for Robin Garbutt argue the Post Office Inquiry has shed new light on his case.
articles.title: Postmaster jailed for wife's murder seeks appeal on Horizon evidence

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Laura Barlow "could have lived for longer" had she been seen face-to-face, her husband believes.
articles.title: Woman who died of cancer 'was misdiagnosed on phone call with GP'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A second asteroid hit Earth around the same time causing a "catastrophic" event.
articles.title: Nadir crater: The asteroid that killed the dinosaurs was not alone

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Colombia and a US firm are fighting over a shipwreck in the Caribbean Sea that could be worth $18bn.
articles.title: The fraught battle over the holy grail of shipwrecks

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Rules allowing banks to delay payments to investigate fraud will come into force at the end of October.
articles.title: Bank transfers could be delayed for four days to investigate fraud

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Amanda Abbington feels she was right to complain about her former Strictly partner Giovanni Pernice.
articles.title: Amanda Abbington has 'no regrets' after Strictly complaints about Giovanni Pernice
